o3-2025-04-16.patternDescription: The puzzle simply stretches the tiny 2Ã—2 picture so it becomes a 6Ã—6 checkerboard-like cloth: copy the two cells of each row three times to the right, then copy the two rows downward 3 times BUT every second pair of rows is shown as a left-right mirror image.  (So the order goes: original, mirrored, original.)
o3-2025-04-16.solvingStrategy:
1. If the emojis confuse you, turn them back into the numbers first.  You will see a 2Ã—2 grid.
2. Write the first input row three times in a row.  That gives you 6 cells.
3. Do the same with the second input row.
4. Now make two more pairs of rows: for the 2nd pair flip each of the two original rows left-to-right before repeating them; for the 3rd pair go back to the original ordering again.
5. Stack the three pairs of rows.  You now have a 6Ã—6 answer grid that matches the given solution.
hints: Notice the output is exactly three times wider and three times taller than the input.
Rows 0-1 and 4-5 look exactly like the input repeated; rows 2-3 look like a mirror image.
Nothing changes from block to block within the same pair of rowsâ€”once you build one 2Ã—2 block you just copy it repeatedly.

The alternating mirror rows feel like two sides taking turns, suggesting peaceful interaction rather than hostility.
